title: How to Make Cadbury Eggs

steps.headline: Get a large bowl and electric mixer.
steps.description: Beat the butter, salt, corn syrup, and vanilla in the bowl.

steps.headline: Pour one cup of sugar at a time into the bowl, but mix by hand, not electric mixer, after each sugar cup.
Divide the dough by taking off 1/3 of it.
steps.description: Get a small bowl for that and drop red and yellow food coloring on it. Stir well so the colors get all mixed around.

steps.headline: Use Saran wrap and cover both bowls.
steps.description: Place them in the refrigerator for two hours.

steps.headline: Wait until the dough is firm.
steps.description: With hands, roll a small orange dough ball and roll a white dough ball about twice the size of the orange one. Wrap the white ball around the orange ball and form egg-like shapes out of them.

steps.headline: Brush or lightly grease a cookie sheet with shortening.
steps.description: Place all of the egg pieces onto the cookie sheet and into the refrigerator for another 3 to 4 hours.

steps.headline: Get a small bowl and mix the shortening and chocolate chips in it.
steps.description: Place the bowl in the microwave for one minute on high heat. Stir ingredients together and microwave them for another minute.

steps.headline: Take the egg pieces out and dip each piece into the chocolate, using a fork as the holder.
steps.description: Gently place them on wax paper and stick it in the refrigerator for another 1 to 2 hours. Repeat the chocolate dipping and refrigerate again.
